column4: Hi. I understand to run a script I type either ./<scriptname> but what if I want to run it from a different directory? <pathname>/./<scriptname> doesnt work
. stands for the current directory so when you type ./scriptname you are actually telling the shell /pathname/scriptname
the same gfoes for .. (parent directory) or ~ (home directory) they are alias
why not just install from repositories ?
Because the version in the hardy repos is 2.4.1 and it wont open an MTS file I need to edit.
maybe getdev has a newer version of some ppa ? compiling should be the last option
getdeb is a webpage but i just checked they do not have avidemux 2.5 for hardy only 2.4.4
I could try 2.4.4 I suppose. It is newer than 2.4.1 which is what I have currently
I will try that. Thanks. If it doesnt do what I need and I need to compile it from source would you be able to help me?
I already have backports in my software sources
Does that mean my computer is 64 bit or my OS is 64 bit?
well your os is 64 bits and that implies that your cpu is 64 bits too
